revised_title: Persistence of Crystal Axes in Potassium Nitrate's Thermal Transformation
tldr: The authors conducted X-ray diffraction studies on single crystals of potassium nitrate to investigate the persistence of crystal axes during a thermal transformation cycle. They found that after the transformation, pseudo-single crystals were generally obtained, with the 6-axis showing a marked persistence compared to the original 6-axis. The a- and c-axes often underwent rotation about the original direction of the 6-axis. The study provides insights into the geometric and thermodynamic aspects of the transformation.
